original_table_html:
Brand name Product category This is a very handy framework for analyzing brand development opportunities. For example, what strategy did Toyota use when it introduced the Toyota Camry Hybrid? When it introduced the Toyota Prius? The Scion?
Existing New
Existing Line extension Brand extension
New Multibrands New brands
summary_markdown: This framework analyzes brand development opportunities by categorizing strategies based on whether the product category is existing or new, and whether the brand itself is existing or new. When a company uses an existing brand for an existing product category, it's a line extension. Introducing an existing brand into a new product category constitutes a brand extension. If a company uses a new brand for an existing product category, it's a multibrands strategy. Finally, launching a new brand in a new product category is categorized as a new brands strategy. This structure provides a clear matrix for understanding different approaches to brand expansion and market entry.
